justification: "Participants responded to the question 'How much do you like this item?' using a horizontal slider scale (labeled 'I hate it!' at the left end and 'I love it!' at the right end) to indicate their value rating for the option."

measured_by: certainty range slider (percentage of value scale)
justification: "Participants then responded to the question 'What degree of certainty do you have?' ... We measured participants' certainty about value rating in terms of the percentage of the value scale that is not occupied by the reported range of compatible value ratings."

"In a separate task at the end of the experiment, participants provided familiarity ratings for each option… responded to the question 'How familiar are you with this?' using a vertical slider scale labeled 'Not at all!' at the bottom and 'Absolutely!' at the top."

"Participants then responded to the question 'Are you sure about your choice?' using a vertical slider scale (labeled 'Not at all!' at the bottom and 'Absolutely!' at the top) as a report of choice confidence."

"Participants then responded to the question 'To what extent did you think about this choice?' using a horizontal slider scale (labeled 'Not at all!' at the left and 'Really a lot!' at the right) as a report of subjective effort."
